description.en:
Metrology in chemistry is a course on the borderline between analytical chemistry (chemical analysis) - ie the determination of the composition (or content of some substances in a given object) and structure - and metrology (measurement science), and in a somewhat simplified way, the purpose of this subject is: which methods/approaches exist to ensure that the results of chemical analyses are "correct" and how to use these methods. The course is very practical and tries to provide knowledge and skills that can be used directly in the laboratory. Teaching takes the form of lectures, practicums (computer practicums) and seminars, and quite often so-called "lecturepracticumseminars", ie in the same session, students are presented a method/approach, then they take their computers and solve (under the guidance of a teacher) a practical example/problem and thereafter follows a discussion on what information can be deduced from the results.

The course gives knowledge and skills (both in theory and in practice) in the following main subject areas: 
1. Measurement, measurement result, measurement uncertainty in chemistry (Basics of measurement, measurement uncertainty, The ISO GUM method of uncertainty estimation, The Nordtest method for uncertainty estimation) 
2. Traceability, validation, reference materials, interlaboratory comparisons (Traceability of measurement results, Traceability in Chemistry, Interlaboratory comparisons, Reference Materials, Validation of analysis procedures)
description.et:
Metroloogia keemias on õppeaine, mis asub analüütilise keemia (keemiliste analüüside) - st ainete koostise (või ühtedes ainetes teiste ainete sisalduse) ja struktuuri määramise teadus - ning metroloogia (mõõtmiste teadus) piiri peal ja mõnevõrra lihtsustatult võib selle aine eesmärgi sõnastada nii: millised meetodid/lähenemisviisid on olemas selleks, et keemiliste analüüside tulemused oleksid "õiged" ja kuidas neid meetodeid kasutada. Aine on väga praktiline ja üritab anda teadmised ja oskused, mis on vahetult laboris kasutatavad. Õppetöö toimub loengute, praktikumide (arvutipraktikumid) ja seminaridena ja päris sageli ka niiöelda "loengpraktikumseminaridena", st sama õppetunni raames esitatakse tudengitele mingi meetod/lähenemisviis, siis võtavad tudengid oma arvutid ja lahendavad (õppejõu juhendamisel) vastava näiteülesande ning seejärel arutatakse ühiselt, mida saadud tulemustest võib järeldada.

Kursus annab teadmised kahes põhilises valdkonnas: 
1. Mõõtmine, mõõtetulemus, mõõtemääramatus keemias (mõõtmiste ja mõõtemääramatuse põhiprintsiibid, ISO GUM ja Nordtest meetodid määramatuse hindamiseks) 
2. Jälgitavus, valideerimine, referentsmaterjalid, laboritevahelised võrdlusmõõtmised

objectives.en: The course gives knowledge on chemical measurements and analyses, assurance of reliability of measurement results and reporting interpreting of measurement results according to contemporary international requirements.
objectives.et: Loengukursus annab teadmised keemilisteks mõõtmiseks ja analüüsideks, mõõtetulemuste usaldusväärsuse tagamiseks, mõõtetulemuste esitamiseks ja interpreteerimiseks kooskõlas tänapäevaste rahvusvaheliste nõuetega.

independent_work.et: The list of independent homework together with instructions and examples can be found at https://www.is.ut.ee/pls/ois/tere.tulemast?viit=4566482

description.et: The final score is formed at examination which, depending on preliminary agreement, can contain written and/or oral parts. The theoretical questions of examination are already known to the students (available at https://www.is.ut.ee/pls/ois/tere.tulemast?viit=4566486). The practical exercises are not known, but the exercise types are known (and have been practiced during the semester). The evaluation is statistical: the student will receive 3-5 questions/problems from a large number of possible questions/problems. Every question has been assigned a weight and they will be separately evaluated using a ten-point system. For estimation of knowledge of concepts their understanding, ability of construction of conclusions and knowledge of the facts is considered. The resulting scores are summed (using the weights) and the sum is normalized to 100.

grade_preconditions.et: All students who have successfully completed all homeworks will be admitted to the exam.

grade_evaluation.et: The examination final score is formed on the basis of the examination answers. The sum of scores is converted to the mark using the classical scheme: 50-60 E; 60-70 D; 70-80 C; 80-90 B; 90-100 A. If the result falls exactly on the borderline then the higher mark is used.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
